1: %% @doc Property-based tests for router_policy_store
    2: %% Uses PropEr for randomized sequence of operations to detect race conditions
    3: -module(router_policy_store_prop_SUITE).
    4: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    5: 
    6: %% Check if PropEr is available
    7: -ifdef(TEST).
    8: -define(HAVE_PROPER, code:which(proper) =/= non_existing).
    9: -else.
   10: -define(HAVE_PROPER, false).
   11: -endif.
   12: 
   13: -ifdef(HAVE_PROPER).
   14: -include_lib("proper/include/proper.hrl").
   15: -endif.
   16: 
   17: -compile(export_all).
   18: 
   19: -export([all/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   20: 
   21: -include("beamline_router.hrl").
   22: 
   23: all() ->
   24:     [
   25:         prop_concurrent_operations,
   26:         prop_upsert_delete_consistency,
   27:         prop_list_policies_ordering,
   28:         prop_index_consistency
   29:     ].
   30: 
   31: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   32:     %% Start application with ephemeral port
   33:     _ = application:load(beamline_router),
   34:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, grpc_port, 0),
   35:     %% Disable heir/transfer logic for faster test execution
   36:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, disable_heir, true),
   37:     case application:ensure_all_started(beamline_router) of
   38:         {ok, _} ->
   39:             {ok, Config};
   40:         Error ->
   41:             ct:fail("Failed to start beamline_router: ~p", [Error])
   42:     end.
   43: 
   44: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   45:     application:stop(beamline_router),
   46:     ok.
   47: 
   48: %% Property: Concurrent operations maintain consistency
   49: prop_concurrent_operations(_Config) ->
   50:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
   51:         false ->
   52:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
   53:         true ->
   54:             Prop = ?FORALL(
   55:                 Operations,
   56:                 list(operation()),
   57:                 begin
   58:                     TenantId = <<"prop_tenant">>,
   59:                     %% Execute operations sequentially (gen_server serializes)
   60:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Operations],
   61:                     
   62:                     %% Verify final state is consistent
   63:                     {ok, FinalPolicies} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
   64:                     
   65:                     %% Check: all policies in list should be valid
   66:                     AllValid = lists:all(fun(P) ->
   67:                         is_record(P, policy) andalso
   68:                         P#policy.tenant_id =:= TenantId
   69:                     end, FinalPolicies),
   70:                     
   71:                     %% Check: no duplicate policy_ids
   72:                     PolicyIds = [P#policy.policy_id || P <- FinalPolicies],
   73:                     NoDuplicates = length(PolicyIds) =:= length(lists:usort(PolicyIds)),
   74:                     
   75:                     AllValid andalso NoDuplicates
   76:                 end
   77:             ),
   78:             case proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}, {max_shrink, 50}]) of
   79:                 true -> ok;
   80:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
   81:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample])
   82:             end
   83:     end.
   84: 
   85: %% Property: Upsert and delete maintain consistency
   86: prop_upsert_delete_consistency(_Config) ->
   87:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
   88:         false ->
   89:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
   90:         true ->
   91:             Prop = ?FORALL(
   92:                 {Upserts, Deletes},
   93:                 {list(upsert_operation()), list(delete_operation())},
   94:                 begin
   95:                     TenantId = <<"prop_consistency_tenant">>,
   96:                     
   97:                     %% Execute all upserts
   98:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Upserts],
   99:                     
  100:                     %% Execute all deletes
  101:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Deletes],
  102:                     
  103:                     %% Verify: deleted policies should not be in list
  104:                     {ok, Policies} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  105:                     PolicyIds = [P#policy.policy_id || P <- Policies],
  106:                     
  107:                     %% Get deleted policy IDs
  108:                     DeletedIds = [PolicyId || {delete, PolicyId} <- Deletes],
  109:                     
  110:                     %% Check: no deleted policy should be in final list
  111:                     lists:all(fun(DeletedId) ->
  112:                         not lists:member(DeletedId, PolicyIds)
  113:                     end, DeletedIds)
  114:                 end
  115:             ),
  116:             case proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}, {max_shrink, 50}]) of
  117:                 true -> ok;
  118:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
  119:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample])
  120:             end
  121:     end.
  122: 
  123: %% Property: list_policies always returns sorted results
  124: prop_list_policies_ordering(_Config) ->
  125:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
  126:         false ->
  127:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
  128:         true ->
  129:             Prop = ?FORALL(
  130:                 Policies,
  131:                 list(policy()),
  132:                 begin
  133:                     TenantId = <<"prop_ordering_tenant">>,
  134:                     
  135:                     %% Clear existing policies
  136:                     {ok, Existing} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  137:                     [router_policy_store:delete_policy(TenantId, P#policy.policy_id) || P <- Existing],
  138:                     
  139:                     %% Insert all policies
  140:                     [router_policy_store:upsert_policy(TenantId, P) || P <- Policies],
  141:                     
  142:                     %% Get list
  143:                     {ok, Listed} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  144:                     
  145:                     %% Check: results are sorted by policy_id (lexicographic binary order)
  146:                     PolicyIds = [P#policy.policy_id || P <- Listed],
  147:                     Sorted = lists:sort(fun(Id1, Id2) ->
  148:                         binary:compare(Id1, Id2) =:= less
  149:                     end, PolicyIds),
  150:                     
  151:                     PolicyIds =:= Sorted
  152:                 end
  153:             ),
  154:             case proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}, {max_shrink, 50}]) of
  155:                 true -> ok;
  156:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
  157:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample])
  158:             end
  159:     end.
  160: 
  161: %% Property: Secondary index maintains consistency with main table
  162: prop_index_consistency(_Config) ->
  163:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
  164:         false ->
  165:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
  166:         true ->
  167:             Prop = ?FORALL(
  168:                 Operations,
  169:                 list(operation()),
  170:                 begin
  171:                     TenantId = <<"prop_index_tenant">>,
  172:                     
  173:                     %% Execute operations
  174:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Operations],
  175:                     
  176:                     %% Get policies via list_policies (uses index)
  177:                     {ok, IndexedPolicies} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  178:                     IndexedIds = lists:sort([P#policy.policy_id || P <- IndexedPolicies]),
  179:                     
  180:                     %% Get policies via direct lookup (bypasses index)
  181:                     AllKeys = ets:match(policy_store, {{TenantId, '$1'}, '_'}),
  182:                     DirectIds = lists:sort([Id || [Id] <- AllKeys]),
  183:                     
  184:                     %% Check: index and direct lookup should match
  185:                     IndexConsistent = IndexedIds =:= DirectIds,
  186:                     
  187:                     %% Check: for each {TenantId, PolicyId} in main table, there's exactly one entry in index
  188:                     IndexTable = policy_store_index,
  189:                     AllIndexEntries = ets:match_object(IndexTable, {TenantId, '_'}),
  190:                     IndexPolicyIds = lists:sort([PolicyId || {_TenantId, PolicyId} <- AllIndexEntries]),
  191:                     
  192:                     %% Check: all policies in main table have corresponding index entries
  193:                     AllMainPolicies = ets:match_object(policy_store, {{TenantId, '_'}, '_'}),
  194:                     MainPolicyIds = lists:sort([PolicyId || {{_TenantId, PolicyId}, _Policy} <- AllMainPolicies]),
  195:                     
  196:                     IndexComplete = MainPolicyIds =:= IndexPolicyIds,
  197:                     
  198:                     %% Check: bag index invariants
  199:                     %% 1. Each {TenantId, PolicyId} pair appears exactly once in index
  200:                     %% Bag allows multiple entries per key, but each {tenant_id, policy_id} pair should be unique
  201:                     IndexPairs = [{T, P} || {T, P} <- AllIndexEntries],
  202:                     UniquePairs = lists:usort(IndexPairs),
  203:                     NoDuplicates = length(IndexPairs) =:= length(UniquePairs),
  204:                     
  205:                     %% 2. For each policy in main table, there's exactly one index entry
  206:                     OneToOne = length(MainPolicyIds) =:= length(IndexPolicyIds),
  207:                     
  208:                     %% 3. Bag index deletion uses delete_object (not delete)
  209:                     %% This ensures that only specific {tenant_id, policy_id} pairs are removed,
  210:                     %% not all entries for a tenant_id
  211:                     %% Verification: index should only contain pairs that exist in main table
  212:                     IndexPairsSet = sets:from_list(IndexPairs),
  213:                     MainPairsSet = sets:from_list([{TenantId, PolicyId} || {{_T, PolicyId}, _} <- AllMainPolicies]),
  214:                     IndexMatchesMain = sets:is_equal(IndexPairsSet, MainPairsSet),
  215:                     
  216:                     %% All checks must pass
  217:                     IndexConsistent andalso IndexComplete andalso NoDuplicates andalso OneToOne andalso IndexMatchesMain
  218:                 end
  219:             ),
  220:             case proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}, {max_shrink, 50}]) of
  221:                 true -> ok;
  222:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
  223:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample])
  224:             end
  225:     end.
  226: 
  227: %% Generators
  228: 
  229: operation() ->
  230:     oneof([
  231:         upsert_operation(),
  232:         delete_operation()
  233:     ]).
  234: 
  235: upsert_operation() ->
  236:     ?LET(
  237:         {PolicyId, Weights},
  238:         {policy_id(), weights()},
  239:         {upsert, #policy{
  240:             tenant_id = <<"prop_tenant">>,
  241:             policy_id = PolicyId,
  242:             weights = Weights,
  243:             version = <<"1.0">>,
  244:             defaults = #{},
  245:             escalate_on = [],
  246:             fallback = undefined,
  247:             sticky = undefined,
  248:             metadata = #{}
  249:         }}
  250:     ).
  251: 
  252: delete_operation() ->
  253:     ?LET(
  254:         PolicyId,
  255:         policy_id(),
  256:         {delete, PolicyId}
  257:     ).
  258: 
  259: policy() ->
  260:     ?LET(
  261:         {PolicyId, Weights},
  262:         {policy_id(), weights()},
  263:         #policy{
  264:             tenant_id = <<"prop_tenant">>,
  265:             policy_id = PolicyId,
  266:             weights = Weights,
  267:             version = <<"1.0">>,
  268:             defaults = #{},
  269:             escalate_on = [],
  270:             fallback = undefined,
  271:             sticky = undefined,
  272:             metadata = #{}
  273:         }
  274:     ).
  275: 
  276: policy_id() ->
  277:     ?LET(
  278:         N,
  279:         integer(1, 1000),
  280:         list_to_binary("policy_" ++ integer_to_list(N))
  281:     ).
  282: 
  283: weights() ->
  284:     ?LET(
  285:         Providers,
  286:         list({provider_id(), weight()}),
  287:         maps:from_list(Providers)
  288:     ).
  289: 
  290: provider_id() ->
  291:     oneof([<<"openai">>, <<"anthropic">>, <<"cohere">>]).
  292: 
  293: weight() ->
  294:     ?LET(
  295:         W,
  296:         real(),
  297:         max(0.0, min(1.0, abs(W)))
  298:     ).
  299: 
  300: %% Helpers
  301: 
  302: execute_operation(TenantId, {upsert, Policy}) ->
  303:     router_policy_store:upsert_policy(TenantId, Policy);
  304: execute_operation(TenantId, {delete, PolicyId}) ->
  305:     router_policy_store:delete_policy(TenantId, PolicyId).
  306:
